author: hdmoadmin
title: It’s Game Day!
text:
5:05 am - October 09, 2015 It’s Game Day! 
TODAY’S TICKET : Lamar at Booneville 
GAME : Booneville (1-4, 0-2) vs Lamar (5-0, 2-0) 
MASCOTS : Booneville Bearcats; Lamar Warriors 
WHEN : 7 p.m., Friday, Oct. 10 at Bearcat Stadium 
SERIES : Booneville leads 5-0-0 (1.000) 
LAST MEETING : Booneville 36 Lamar 12 on Oct. 9, 2014 
LAST WEEK : Danville 64 Booneville 53; Lamar 50 Mansfield 20 
STREAK : Booneville has won last 5 
FIRST MEETING : Booneville 21 Lamar 7 in 1996 
CONFERENCE AFFILIATIONS : Both are members of the 3A-4. 
THE COACHES SAID : Before the season began, Booneville was picked 3rd the 3A-4; Lamar wass picked to win the 3A-4 
BROADCAST : The Fort 94.5 and on the radio station’s website 
NOTES : Making his first start in the backfield last week Max Phonlasouk seemed right at home. He accounted for 51 rushing yards and a touchdown on a 16-yard run that got the Bearcats on the board, and caught a 29-yard pass. To put that into perspective he carried for 34 yards on seven carries all of last year and had exactly one 4-yard carry for the junior high as a freshman. 
After throwing for 52 yards in the nonconference portion of the schedule, Hayden Fennell has thrown for 291 in two weeks of conference play. Want more perspective, his 343 yard total to date is already more than the 306 the Bearcats combined (four passers) to throw for last year and it’s only 106 shy of the 2013 championship season passing total. 
THIS DATE IN BEARCAT HISTORY: The Bearcats are 10-2-1 all time in games documented to have been played on Oct. 9. More often than not the opponent has been Mansfield (7-0-1). 
Notable performances on the date include the first ever 5 2-point conversion game against Mansfield in a 46-0 win over Mansfield on Oct. 9, 1970. Ray Asbury scored two of the 2s. 
The most recent Oct. 9 game was in 2009 when Talor Tatterson ran for 72 yards on one play and 164 in the game in a 28-21 win over Pottsville. Brock May also had a 68-yard TD run that night. 
Brandon Rowland started the 10-9-1998 game at Lavaca with a kickoff return for a touchdown. It was called back. He scored on the first offensive play from 89 yards out. Rowland finished with 164 and the Bearcats won 53-0. 
Randy May ran for 164 yards on Oct. 9, 1992 in a 48-13 win over Mansfield; Garfield Hodges had a 79-yard run against Mansfield on Oct. 9, 1959, but he didn’t score. The Bearcats won 21-13.
